clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study on the Correlation Between IMR（Index of Microcirculation Resistance） and FFR（Fractional Flow Reserve）
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Study on the Correlation Between IMR（Index of Microcirculation Resistance） and FFR（Fractional Flow Reserve）

lead_sponsor.agency: The People's Hospital of Liaoning Province

clinical_study.source: The People's Hospital of Liaoning Province

brief_summary.textblock: To study the effect of myocardial microcirculation disturbance on coronary flow reserve fraction, compare the evaluation value of IMR, FFR and QCA on myocardial ischemia, and discuss the correlation among them.

detailed_description.textblock: In this study, 60 patients with critical lesions indicated by coronary angiography will be admitted. The investigators collected the basic clinical data (gender, age, body mass index, smoking history, hypertension, diabetes, hyperlipidemia), laboratory data (creatinine, cholesterol, triglycerides) and measured their FFR and IMR.

arm_group.description: Quantitative coronary angiography (QCA) showed that there was a critical lesion in the proximal or middle segment of the coronary artery (diameter stenosis rate was 50% - 70%), and the diameter of the artery was more than 2.5mm

intervention.description: FFR measurement: Pressure guid wire(radianalyzer Xpress 12711) is produced in Switzerland. After the pressure of the aorta and the pressure guide wire is balanced, Send the pressure guide wire to the distal part of the lesion(more than 20 mm away from the lesion) . Adenosine is injected into the vein,then,record the FFR index 3 times and take the average value as the final measurement index.
